Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sys::TaskInfo::TaskInfo ( int  tid = 0)
inline

Constructs a new object with the give task ID.

Member Function Documentation

u32 sys::TaskInfo::heap_size ( ) const
inline

Returns the heap size available to the task.

u32 sys::TaskInfo::id ( ) const
inline

Returns the thread id.

bool sys::TaskInfo::is_active ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the task is active (not sleeping or blocked).

bool sys::TaskInfo::is_enabled ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the task slot has been assigned.

The system has a fixed number of tasks that it can run. If this returns false, the slot is free to be used by a new task (thread or process).

bool sys::TaskInfo::is_thread ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the task is a thread.

This returns true for a task that was created as a new thread within an application. It returns false for tasks that are creating using Sys::launch().

u32 sys::TaskInfo::memory_size ( ) const
inline

Returns the number of bytes of memory available to the task.

const char* sys::TaskInfo::name ( ) const
inline

Returns the name of the task.

u32 sys::TaskInfo::pid ( ) const
inline

Returns that process ID of the task.

void sys::TaskInfo::print ( ) const

Prints information about the task to the standard output.

static void sys::TaskInfo::print_header ( )
static

Prints the header info for the print() method.

u8 sys::TaskInfo::priority ( ) const
inline

Returns the task priority.

u8 sys::TaskInfo::priority_ceiling ( ) const
inline

Returns the task priority ceiling (if it has a mutex locked).

u32 sys::TaskInfo::stack_size ( ) const
inline

Returns the stack sizve of the current task.

u32 sys::TaskInfo::thread_id ( ) const
inline

Returns the task id (same value as thread_id()).
